text.div:
FHIR/v3 Address Use Mapping (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/101)

Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/address-use to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/v3-AddressUse

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 13/06/2012 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir; ). Creative Commons 0

A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems


Source Code Equivalence Destination Code Comments
home (Home) equivalent H (home address)
home (Home) equivalent H (home address)
work (Work) equivalent WP (work place)
temp (Temporary) equivalent TMP (temporary address)
old (Old / Incorrect) disjoint BAD (bad address) In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

fhir_comments:
for version, we are going to simply use the day of publication. This is also 
    arbitrary - whatever is here is what people use to refer to the version. 
    Could also be a UUID too

resource.name: FHIR/v3 Address Use Mapping

fhir_comments: set of loinc codes for cholesterol for LONC 2.36

resource.description: A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems
resource.requirements: To help implementers map from HL7 v3/CDA to FHIR

target.comments: In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

text.div:
SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/103)

Mapping from SNOMED-CT to http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-us

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 13/06/2012 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir; ). Creative Commons 0

Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna


Source Code Equivalence Destination Code Comments
263204007 (Fracture of shaft of ulna (disorder)) narrower S52.209A (??) The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.
263204007 (Fracture of shaft of ulna (disorder)) narrower S52.209D (??) The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

fhir_comments:
for version, we are going to simply use the day of publication. This is also 
    arbitrary - whatever is here is what people use to refer to the version. 
    Could also be a UUID too

resource.name: SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna

fhir_comments: example SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM rule-based maps for fracture of ulna

resource.description: Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna

fhir_comments: The version is not normally required for SNOMED CT - this is an example.
The specific version may be required for ICD-10-CM.
Unspecified fracture of shaft of unspecified ulna (initial encounter for closed fracture)

target.comments: The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

fhir_comments: The version is not normally required for SNOMED CT - this is an example.
The specific version may be required for ICD-10-CM.
Unspecified fracture of shaft of unspecified ulna (subsequent encounter for closed fracture with routine healing)

target.comments: The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

DRAFT. Published on 25/07/2013 by FHIR project team (original source: LabMCoP) ( http://hl7.org/fhir; , http://www.phconnect.org/group...; ).

Code [http://hl7.org/fhir/v2/0487] Code [http://snomed.info/sct] v2 SPM-7 [http://snomed.info/sct] v2 SPM-8 [http://snomed.info/sct] v2 SPM-5 [http://snomed.info/sct]

AUTP (Autopsy) UNMATCHED This really is not a specimen per se - it is the state of the subject from whom the specimen is collected, so it should be used as a specimen type modifier ONLY!. Often this is indicated with a special medical record number or other notation on the patient. needs to have specimen type (SPM-4) and source site (SPM.8) and spatial orientation (SPM.9)

fhir_comments: version: the date of the source

resource.name: Specimen mapping from v2 table 0487 to SNOMED CT

target.comments: HL7 term is a historical term. mapped to Pus

This really is not a specimen per se - it is the state of the subject from whom the specimen is collected, so it should be used as a  specimen type modifier ONLY!. Often this is indicated with a special medical record number or other notation on the patient. needs to have specimen type (SPM-4) and source site (SPM.8) and spatial orientation (SPM.9)
